titles.title: Citizen Involvement in Campaigns Act of 2003
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a credit and a deduction for small political contributions.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/7/2003--Introduced. Citizen Involvement in Campaigns Act of 2003 - Permits an individual a tax credit of up to $200 ($400 in the case of a joint return), equal to the verified amount of certain political contributions the individual made during the taxable year. Denies a deduction for any amount taken into account in determining the credit permitted in this Act.Allows a deduction of up to $600 ($1200 for a joint return). Allows the deduction whether or not a taxpayer itemizes other deductions.
